availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Valentine R. Kemper (Montgomery County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Montgomery County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of William Kemper and Sally Rogers Kemper. Farmer in Montgomery County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned twelve enslaved persons in Montgomery County in 1850. Farmer in Montgomery County in 1860. Household owned twelve enslaved persons in Montgomery County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, District 1, p. 18A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, District 1, p. 65.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, p. 284.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, p. 17.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, Aarons Run, p. 237B.
Willis Miller Kemper and Harry Linn Wright, eds. Genealogy of the Kemper Family in the United States, (Chicago: George K. Hazlitt & Company, 1899), p. 79, 111.
"Valentine R. Kemper (1812-1887)," Find A Grave, Memorial 117175020, accessed October 20, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/117175020.
